item.title: Hetzner DIY Private Networking with tinc
item.description: Hetzner has a reputation for offering a sweet price/performance ratio, however, in a true Unix philosophy, it comes at a cost of having to do everything by yourself. Including Private Networking. Normally you only get one public IP and no private interfaces. I suspect they might have some clever routing rules in place for traffic to never leave the DC, but somehow I don’t really fancy sending unencrypted traffic over public IPs.

item.title: TDD with Go
item.description: I often find myself tinkering with Go as it possesses many of the language qualities I like - statically typed, compiled language that in many ways is similar to C, but with memory safety and garbage collection. Test-driven development (TDD) is a software development technique that relies on very short, repetitive development cycles. Business requirements are turned into very specific test cases, then the software is improved until tests are passing.
